SEARCH
Package nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.storage

Class DelayedPreparedStatement

java.lang.Object
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.storage.DelayedPreparedStatement
public class DelayedPreparedStatement extends Object
Represents a wrapper around PreparedStatement. It can be used to set variables before obtaining a connection.

It also allows you to easily create a String containing the full statement with all the variable substituted, which can be useful for debugging purposes.

Author:
Pim

    • DelayedPreparedStatement

      public DelayedPreparedStatement(String statement)
      Constructs a new DelayedPreparedStatement.

      It counts the number of variables ('?' characters) in the statement.

      Parameters:
      statement - The SQL statement.

    • DelayedPreparedStatement

      public DelayedPreparedStatement(int variableCount, String statement)
      Constructs a new DelayedPreparedStatement.
      Parameters:
      variableCount - The number of variables ('?' characters) in the statement.
      statement - The SQL statement.

      public PreparedStatement construct(Connection conn) throws SQLException
      Constructs a PreparedStatement from this DelayedPreparedStatement, applying all variables as defined up to this point.
      Parameters:
      conn - A connection to a database.
      Returns:
      The constructed PreparedStatement.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • construct

      public PreparedStatement construct(Connection conn, int autoGeneratedKeys) throws SQLException
      Constructs a PreparedStatement from this DelayedPreparedStatement, applying all variables as defined up to this point.
      Parameters:
      conn - A connection to a database.
      autoGeneratedKeys - A flag indicating whether auto-generated keys should be returned; one of Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS or Statement.NO_GENERATED_KEYS
      Returns:
      The constructed PreparedStatement.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • setRawString

      public DelayedPreparedStatement setRawString(int idx, String obj)
      Replaces a '?' at the given index with a raw String. Unlike all other types, this is executed before constructing the actual PreparedStatement and modifies statement.

      Note that you'll have to make sure that the String is sanitized and valid. For example, when using it to specify the name of a table, the name must comply with IStorage.isValidTableName(String). This means that only alphanumerics characters and the underscore character are allowed.

      Most importantly: When using this method, it MUST BE USED in the correct order. Variables that should be set before should be added before and those that should be set after should be added after.

      Parameters:
      idx - The index of the variable character (= "?") in the statement that should be replaced by the table name.
      obj - The name of the table.
      Returns:
      This DelayedPreparedStatement.

    • setNextBoolean

      public DelayedPreparedStatement setNextBoolean(Boolean obj)
      See PreparedStatement.setBoolean(int, boolean).

      The index used is simply the one following from the previous set action.

      Returns:
